alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 4:53PM AKST until March 01 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts possible. North winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially along the Sterling Highway corridor from Homer to Soldotna and northward to Kenai and Nikiski. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect widespread snow across the western Kenai, but the heaviest snow and highest snow totals are expected near Cook Inlet, including the Sterling Highway corridor from Anchor Point to Soldotna and northward to Kenai and Nikiski. The heaviest snowfall is expected near the onset of the event Tuesday morning. Lighter snowfall, with some breaks, especially for inland locations, will persist into the evening and overnight before another round of heavier snow early Wednesday morning through midday Wednesday. Snow is expected to be fluffy and areas where there will be higher winds could see reduced visibility and potential for snow drifts.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
